instance ToHeaders DescribeEvaluations
instance ToQuery DescribeEvaluations
instance ToPath DescribeEvaluations


-- | Returns a list of <a>DataSource</a> that match the search criteria in
--   the request.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://http://docs.aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeDataSources.html</a>
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning.DescribeDataSources
data DescribeDataSources

-- | <a>DescribeDataSources</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ddsEQ</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsFilterVariable</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>DataSourceFilterVariable</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsGE</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsGT</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsLE</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsLT</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsNE</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsNextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsPrefix</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsSortOrder</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>SortOrder</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeDataSources :: DescribeDataSources

-- | The equal to operator. The <a>DataSource</a> results will have
--   <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that exactly match the value specified
--   with <a>EQ</a>.
ddsEQ :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe Text)

-- | Use one of the following variables to filter a list of
--   <a>DataSource</a>:
--   
--   <tt>CreatedAt</tt> - Sets the search criteria to <a>DataSource</a>
--   creation dates. <a>Status</a> - Sets the search criteria to
--   <a>DataSource</a> statuses. <tt>Name</tt> - Sets the search criteria
--   to the contents of <a>DataSource</a> <tt>Name</tt>. <tt>DataUri</tt> -
--   Sets the search criteria to the URI of data files used to create the
--   <a>DataSource</a>. The URI can identify either a file or an Amazon
--   Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or directory.
--   <tt>IAMUser</tt> - Sets the search criteria to the user account that
--   invoked the <a>DataSource</a> creation.
ddsFilterVariable :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe DataSourceFilterVariable)

-- | The greater than or equal to operator. The <a>DataSource</a> results
--   will have <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that are greater than or
--   equal to the value specified with <tt>GE</tt>.
ddsGE :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe Text)

-- | The greater than operator. The <a>DataSource</a> results will have
--   <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that are greater than the value
--   specified with <a>GT</a>.
ddsGT :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe Text)

-- | The less than or equal to operator. The <a>DataSource</a> results will
--   have <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that are less than or equal to the
--   value specified with <tt>LE</tt>.
ddsLE :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe Text)

-- | The less than operator. The <a>DataSource</a> results will have
--   <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that are less than the value specified
--   with <a>LT</a>.
ddsLT :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of <a>DataSource</a> to include in the result.
ddsLimit :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe Natural)

-- | The not equal to operator. The <a>DataSource</a> results will have
--   <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values not equal to the value specified with
--   <tt>NE</tt>.
ddsNE :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the page in the paginated results.
ddsNextToken :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that is found at the beginning of a variable, such as
--   <tt>Name</tt> or <tt>Id</tt>.
--   
--   For example, a <a>DataSource</a> could have the <tt>Name</tt>
--   '2014-09-09-HolidayGiftMailer'. To search for this <a>DataSource</a>,
--   select <tt>Name</tt> for the <tt>FilterVariable</tt> and any of the
--   following strings for the <tt>Prefix</tt>:
--   
--   2014-09
--   
--   2014-09-09
--   
--   2014-09-09-Holiday
ddsPrefix :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe Text)

-- | A two-value parameter that determines the sequence of the resulting
--   list of <a>DataSource</a>.
--   
--   <tt>asc</tt> - Arranges the list in ascending order (A-Z, 0-9).
--   <tt>dsc</tt> - Arranges the list in descending order (Z-A, 9-0).
--   Results are sorted by <tt>FilterVariable</tt>.
ddsSortOrder :: Lens' DescribeDataSources (Maybe SortOrder)
data DescribeDataSourcesResponse

-- | <a>DescribeDataSourcesResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ddsrNextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ddsrResults</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>DataSource</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeDataSourcesResponse :: DescribeDataSourcesResponse

-- | An ID of the next page in the paginated results that indicates at
--   least one more page follows.
ddsrNextToken :: Lens' DescribeDataSourcesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of <a>DataSource</a> that meet the search criteria.
ddsrResults :: Lens' DescribeDataSourcesResponse [DataSource]
instance Eq DescribeDataSources
instance Read DescribeDataSources
instance Show DescribeDataSources
instance Eq DescribeDataSourcesResponse
instance Read DescribeDataSourcesResponse
instance Show DescribeDataSourcesResponse
instance AWSPager DescribeDataSources
instance FromJSON DescribeDataSourcesResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeDataSources
instance ToJSON DescribeDataSources
instance ToHeaders DescribeDataSources
instance ToQuery DescribeDataSources
instance ToPath DescribeDataSources


-- | Returns a list of <a>BatchPrediction</a> operations that match the
--   search criteria in the request.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://http://docs.aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeBatchPredictions.html</a>
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning.DescribeBatchPredictions
data DescribeBatchPredictions

-- | <a>DescribeBatchPredictions</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dbpEQ</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpFilterVariable</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>BatchPredictionFilterVariable</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpGE</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpGT</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpLE</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpLT</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpLimit</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Natural</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpNE</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpNextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpPrefix</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbpSortOrder</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>SortOrder</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeBatchPredictions :: DescribeBatchPredictions

-- | The equal to operator. The <a>BatchPrediction</a> results will have
--   <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that exactly match the value specified
--   with <a>EQ</a>.
dbpEQ :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe Text)

-- | Use one of the following variables to filter a list of
--   <a>BatchPrediction</a>:
--   
--   <tt>CreatedAt</tt> - Sets the search criteria to the
--   <a>BatchPrediction</a> creation date. <a>Status</a> - Sets the search
--   criteria to the <a>BatchPrediction</a> status. <tt>Name</tt> - Sets
--   the search criteria to the contents of the <a>BatchPrediction</a>
--   <tt>Name</tt>. <tt>IAMUser</tt> - Sets the search criteria to the user
--   account that invoked the <a>BatchPrediction</a> creation.
--   <tt>MLModelId</tt> - Sets the search criteria to the <a>MLModel</a>
--   used in the <a>BatchPrediction</a>. <tt>DataSourceId</tt> - Sets the
--   search criteria to the <a>DataSource</a> used in the
--   <a>BatchPrediction</a>. <tt>DataURI</tt> - Sets the search criteria to
--   the data file(s) used in the <a>BatchPrediction</a>. The URL can
--   identify either a file or an Amazon Simple Storage Solution (Amazon
--   S3) bucket or directory.
dbpFilterVariable :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe BatchPredictionFilterVariable)

-- | The greater than or equal to operator. The <a>BatchPrediction</a>
--   results will have <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that are greater than
--   or equal to the value specified with <tt>GE</tt>.
dbpGE :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe Text)

-- | The greater than operator. The <a>BatchPrediction</a> results will
--   have <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that are greater than the value
--   specified with <a>GT</a>.
dbpGT :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe Text)

-- | The less than or equal to operator. The <a>BatchPrediction</a> results
--   will have <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that are less than or equal
--   to the value specified with <tt>LE</tt>.
dbpLE :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe Text)

-- | The less than operator. The <a>BatchPrediction</a> results will have
--   <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values that are less than the value specified
--   with <a>LT</a>.
dbpLT :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of pages of information to include in the result. The range
--   of acceptable values is 1 through 100. The default value is 100.
dbpLimit :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe Natural)

-- | The not equal to operator. The <a>BatchPrediction</a> results will
--   have <tt>FilterVariable</tt> values not equal to the value specified
--   with <tt>NE</tt>.
dbpNE :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe Text)

-- | An ID of the page in the paginated results.
dbpNextToken :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that is found at the beginning of a variable, such as
--   <tt>Name</tt> or <tt>Id</tt>.
--   
--   For example, a 'Batch Prediction' operation could have the
--   <tt>Name</tt> '2014-09-09-HolidayGiftMailer'. To search for this
--   <a>BatchPrediction</a>, select <tt>Name</tt> for the
--   <tt>FilterVariable</tt> and any of the following strings for the
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>:
--   
--   2014-09
--   
--   2014-09-09
--   
--   2014-09-09-Holiday
dbpPrefix :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe Text)

-- | A two-value parameter that determines the sequence of the resulting
--   list of <a>MLModel</a>s.
--   
--   <tt>asc</tt> - Arranges the list in ascending order (A-Z, 0-9).
--   <tt>dsc</tt> - Arranges the list in descending order (Z-A, 9-0).
--   Results are sorted by <tt>FilterVariable</tt>.
dbpSortOrder :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictions (Maybe SortOrder)
data DescribeBatchPredictionsResponse

-- | <a>DescribeBatchPredictionsResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>dbprNextToken</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>dbprResults</a> <tt>::</tt> [<a>BatchPrediction</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
describeBatchPredictionsResponse :: DescribeBatchPredictionsResponse

-- | The ID of the next page in the paginated results that indicates at
--   least one more page follows.
dbprNextToken :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of <a>BatchPrediction</a> objects that meet the search
--   criteria.
dbprResults :: Lens' DescribeBatchPredictionsResponse [BatchPrediction]
instance Eq DescribeBatchPredictions
instance Read DescribeBatchPredictions
instance Show DescribeBatchPredictions
instance Eq DescribeBatchPredictionsResponse
instance Read DescribeBatchPredictionsResponse
instance Show DescribeBatchPredictionsResponse
instance AWSPager DescribeBatchPredictions
instance FromJSON DescribeBatchPredictionsResponse
instance AWSRequest DescribeBatchPredictions
instance ToJSON DescribeBatchPredictions
instance ToHeaders DescribeBatchPredictions
instance ToQuery DescribeBatchPredictions
instance ToPath DescribeBatchPredictions

--   
--   After using the <a>DeleteMLModel</a> operation, you can use the

--   irreversible.

-- | Creates a real-time endpoint for the <a>MLModel</a>. The endpoint
--   contains the URI of the <a>MLModel</a>; that is, the location to send
--   real-time prediction requests for the specified <a>MLModel</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://http://docs.aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/latest/APIReference/API_CreateRealtimeEndpoint.html</a>
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning.CreateRealtimeEndpoint
data CreateRealtimeEndpoint

-- | <a>CreateRealtimeEndpoint</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>creMLModelId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createRealtimeEndpoint :: Text -> CreateRealtimeEndpoint

-- | The ID assigned to the <a>MLModel</a> during creation.
creMLModelId :: Lens' CreateRealtimeEndpoint Text
data CreateRealtimeEndpointResponse

-- | <a>CreateRealtimeEndpointResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>crerMLModelId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>crerRealtimeEndpointInfo</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>RealtimeEndpointInfo</a></li>
--   </ul>
createRealtimeEndpointResponse :: CreateRealtimeEndpointResponse

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the <a>MLModel</a>. This
--   value should be identical to the value of the <tt>MLModelId</tt> in
--   the request.
crerMLModelId :: Lens' CreateRealtimeEndpointResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The endpoint information of the <a>MLModel</a>
crerRealtimeEndpointInfo :: Lens' CreateRealtimeEndpointResponse (Maybe RealtimeEndpointInfo)

-- | Creates a new <a>MLModel</a> using the data files and the recipe as
--   information sources.
--   
--   An <a>MLModel</a> is nearly immutable. Users can only update the
--   <tt>MLModelName</tt> and the <tt>ScoreThreshold</tt> in an
--   <a>MLModel</a> without creating a new <a>MLModel</a>.
--   
--   <a>CreateMLModel</a> is an asynchronous operation. In response to
--   <a>CreateMLModel</a>, Amazon Machine Learning (Amazon ML) immediately
--   returns and sets the <a>MLModel</a> status to <tt>PENDING</tt>. After
--   the <a>MLModel</a> is created and ready for use, Amazon ML sets the
--   status to <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
--   
--   You can use the <tt>GetMLModel</tt> operation to check progress of the
--   <a>MLModel</a> during the creation operation.
--   
--   <a>CreateMLModel</a> requires a <a>DataSource</a> with computed
--   statistics, which can be created by setting <tt>ComputeStatistics</tt>
--   to <tt>true</tt> in <tt>CreateDataSourceFromRDS</tt>,
--   <tt>CreateDataSourceFromS3</tt>, or
--   <tt>CreateDataSourceFromRedshift</tt> operations.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://http://docs.aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/latest/APIReference/API_CreateMLModel.html</a>
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning.CreateMLModel
data CreateMLModel

-- | <a>CreateMLModel</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cmlmMLModelId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cmlmMLModelName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cmlmMLModelType</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>MLModelType</a></li>
--   <li><a>cmlmParameters</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>HashMap</a> <a>Text</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cmlmRecipe</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cmlmRecipeUri</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cmlmTrainingDataSourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createMLModel :: Text -> MLModelType -> Text -> CreateMLModel

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the <a>MLModel</a>.
cmlmMLModelId :: Lens' CreateMLModel Text

-- | A user-supplied name or description of the <a>MLModel</a>.
cmlmMLModelName :: Lens' CreateMLModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The category of supervised learning that this <a>MLModel</a> will
--   address. Choose from the following types:
--   
--   Choose <tt>REGRESSION</tt> if the <a>MLModel</a> will be used to
--   predict a numeric value. Choose <tt>BINARY</tt> if the <a>MLModel</a>
--   result has two possible values. Choose <tt>MULTICLASS</tt> if the
--   <a>MLModel</a> result has a limited number of values. For more
--   information, see the <a>Amazon Machine Learning Developer Guide</a>.
cmlmMLModelType :: Lens' CreateMLModel MLModelType

-- | A list of the training parameters in the <a>MLModel</a>. The list is
--   implemented as a map of key/value pairs.
--   
--   The following is the current set of training parameters:
--   
--   'sgd.l1RegularizationAmount' - Coefficient regularization L1 norm. It
--   controls overfitting the data by penalizing large coefficients. This
--   tends to drive coefficients to zero, resulting in sparse feature set.
--   If you use this parameter, start by specifying a small value such as
--   1.0E-08.
--   
--   The value is a double that ranges from 0 to MAX_DOUBLE. The default is
--   not to use L1 normalization. The parameter cannot be used when
--   <tt>L2</tt> is specified. Use this parameter sparingly.
--   
--   'sgd.l2RegularizationAmount' - Coefficient regularization L2 norm. It
--   controls overfitting the data by penalizing large coefficients. This
--   tends to drive coefficients to small, nonzero values. If you use this
--   parameter, start by specifying a small value such as 1.0E-08.
--   
--   The valuseis a double that ranges from 0 to MAX_DOUBLE. The default is
--   not to use L2 normalization. This cannot be used when <tt>L1</tt> is
--   specified. Use this parameter sparingly.
--   
--   'sgd.maxPasses' - Number of times that the training process traverses
--   the observations to build the <a>MLModel</a>. The value is an integer
--   that ranges from 1 to 10000. The default value is 10.
--   
--   'sgd.maxMLModelSizeInBytes' - Maximum allowed size of the model.
--   Depending on the input data, the size of the model might affect its
--   performance.
--   
--   The value is an integer that ranges from 100000 to 2147483648. The
--   default value is 33554432.
cmlmParameters :: Lens' CreateMLModel (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The data recipe for creating <a>MLModel</a>. You must specify either
--   the recipe or its URI. If you don’t specify a recipe or its URI,
--   Amazon ML creates a default.
cmlmRecipe :: Lens' CreateMLModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) location and file name
--   that contains the <a>MLModel</a> recipe. You must specify either the
--   recipe or its URI. If you don’t specify a recipe or its URI, Amazon ML
--   creates a default.
cmlmRecipeUri :: Lens' CreateMLModel (Maybe Text)

-- | The <a>DataSource</a> that points to the training data.
cmlmTrainingDataSourceId :: Lens' CreateMLModel Text
data CreateMLModelResponse

-- | <a>CreateMLModelResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cmlmrMLModelId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createMLModelResponse :: CreateMLModelResponse

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the <a>MLModel</a>. This
--   value should be identical to the value of the <tt>MLModelId</tt> in
--   the request.
cmlmrMLModelId :: Lens' CreateMLModelResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateMLModel
instance Read CreateMLModel
instance Show CreateMLModel
instance Eq CreateMLModelResponse
instance Ord CreateMLModelResponse
instance Read CreateMLModelResponse
instance Show CreateMLModelResponse
instance Monoid CreateMLModelResponse
instance FromJSON CreateMLModelResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateMLModel
instance ToJSON CreateMLModel
instance ToHeaders CreateMLModel
instance ToQuery CreateMLModel
instance ToPath CreateMLModel


-- | Creates a new <a>Evaluation</a> of an <a>MLModel</a>. An
--   <a>MLModel</a> is evaluated on a set of observations associated to a
--   <a>DataSource</a>. Like a <a>DataSource</a> for an <a>MLModel</a>, the
--   <a>DataSource</a> for an <a>Evaluation</a> contains values for the
--   Target Variable. The <a>Evaluation</a> compares the predicted result
--   for each observation to the actual outcome and provides a summary so
--   that you know how effective the <a>MLModel</a> functions on the test
--   data. Evaluation generates a relevant performance metric such as
--   BinaryAUC, RegressionRMSE or MulticlassAvgFScore based on the
--   corresponding <a>MLModelType</a>: <tt>BINARY</tt>, <tt>REGRESSION</tt>
--   or <tt>MULTICLASS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>CreateEvaluation</a> is an asynchronous operation. In response to
--   <a>CreateEvaluation</a>, Amazon Machine Learning (Amazon ML)
--   immediately returns and sets the evaluation status to
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>. After the <a>Evaluation</a> is created and ready for
--   use, Amazon ML sets the status to <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
--   
--   You can use the <tt>GetEvaluation</tt> operation to check progress of
--   the evaluation during the creation operation.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://http://docs.aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/latest/APIReference/API_CreateEvaluation.html</a>
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning.CreateEvaluation
data CreateEvaluation

-- | <a>CreateEvaluation</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ceEvaluationDataSourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ceEvaluationId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ceEvaluationName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>ceMLModelId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createEvaluation :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateEvaluation

-- | The ID of the <a>DataSource</a> for the evaluation. The schema of the
--   <a>DataSource</a> must match the schema used to create the
--   <a>MLModel</a>.
ceEvaluationDataSourceId :: Lens' CreateEvaluation Text

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the <a>Evaluation</a>.
ceEvaluationId :: Lens' CreateEvaluation Text

-- | A user-supplied name or description of the <a>Evaluation</a>.
ceEvaluationName :: Lens' CreateEvaluation (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the <a>MLModel</a> to evaluate.
--   
--   The schema used in creating the <a>MLModel</a> must match the schema
--   of the <a>DataSource</a> used in the <a>Evaluation</a>.
ceMLModelId :: Lens' CreateEvaluation Text
data CreateEvaluationResponse

-- | <a>CreateEvaluationResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cerEvaluationId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createEvaluationResponse :: CreateEvaluationResponse

-- | The user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the <a>Evaluation</a>.
--   This value should be identical to the value of the
--   <tt>EvaluationId</tt> in the request.
cerEvaluationId :: Lens' CreateEvaluationResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateEvaluation
instance Ord CreateEvaluation
instance Read CreateEvaluation
instance Show CreateEvaluation
instance Eq CreateEvaluationResponse
instance Ord CreateEvaluationResponse
instance Read CreateEvaluationResponse
instance Show CreateEvaluationResponse
instance Monoid CreateEvaluationResponse
instance FromJSON CreateEvaluationResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateEvaluation
instance ToJSON CreateEvaluation
instance ToHeaders CreateEvaluation
instance ToQuery CreateEvaluation
instance ToPath CreateEvaluation


-- | Creates a <a>DataSource</a> object. A <a>DataSource</a> references
--   data that can be used to perform <tt>CreateMLModel</tt>,
--   <tt>CreateEvaluation</tt>, or <tt>CreateBatchPrediction</tt>
--   operations.
--   
--   <a>CreateDataSourceFromS3</a> is an asynchronous operation. In
--   response to <a>CreateDataSourceFromS3</a>, Amazon Machine Learning
--   (Amazon ML) immediately returns and sets the <a>DataSource</a> status
--   to <tt>PENDING</tt>. After the <a>DataSource</a> is created and ready
--   for use, Amazon ML sets the <a>Status</a> parameter to
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt>. <a>DataSource</a> in <tt>COMPLETED</tt> or
--   <tt>PENDING</tt> status can only be used to perform
--   <tt>CreateMLModel</tt>, <tt>CreateEvaluation</tt> or
--   <tt>CreateBatchPrediction</tt> operations.
--   
--   If Amazon ML cannot accept the input source, it sets the <a>Status</a>
--   parameter to <tt>FAILED</tt> and includes an error message in the
--   <tt>Message</tt> attribute of the <tt>GetDataSource</tt> operation
--   response.
--   
--   The observation data used in a <a>DataSource</a> should be ready to
--   use; that is, it should have a consistent structure, and missing data
--   values should be kept to a minimum. The observation data must reside
--   in one or more CSV files in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon
--   S3) bucket, along with a schema that describes the data items by name
--   and type. The same schema must be used for all of the data files
--   referenced by the <a>DataSource</a>.
--   
--   After the <a>DataSource</a> has been created, it's ready to use in
--   evaluations and batch predictions. If you plan to use the
--   <a>DataSource</a> to train an <a>MLModel</a>, the <a>DataSource</a>
--   requires another item: a recipe. A recipe describes the observation
--   variables that participate in training an <a>MLModel</a>. A recipe
--   describes how each input variable will be used in training. Will the
--   variable be included or excluded from training? Will the variable be
--   manipulated, for example, combined with another variable, or split
--   apart into word combinations? The recipe provides answers to these
--   questions. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Machine Learning
--   Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://http://docs.aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/latest/APIReference/API_CreateDataSourceFromS3.html</a>
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning.CreateDataSourceFromS
data CreateDataSourceFromS3

-- | <a>CreateDataSourceFromS3</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cdsfsComputeStatistics</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfsDataSourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfsDataSourceName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfsDataSpec</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>S3DataSpec</a></li>
--   </ul>
createDataSourceFromS3 :: Text -> S3DataSpec -> CreateDataSourceFromS3

-- | The compute statistics for a <a>DataSource</a>. The statistics are
--   generated from the observation data referenced by a <a>DataSource</a>.
--   Amazon ML uses the statistics internally during an <a>MLModel</a>
--   training. This parameter must be set to <tt>true</tt> if the
--   ''DataSource'' needs to be used for <a>MLModel</a> training
cdsfsComputeStatistics :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromS3 (Maybe Bool)

-- | A user-supplied identifier that uniquely identifies the
--   <a>DataSource</a>.
cdsfsDataSourceId :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromS3 Text

-- | A user-supplied name or description of the <a>DataSource</a>.
cdsfsDataSourceName :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromS3 (Maybe Text)

-- | The data specification of a <a>DataSource</a>:
--   
--   DataLocationS3 - Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) location of
--   the observation data.
--   
--   DataSchemaLocationS3 - Amazon S3 location of the <tt>DataSchema</tt>.
--   
--   DataSchema - A JSON string representing the schema. This is not
--   required if <tt>DataSchemaUri</tt> is specified.
--   
--   DataRearrangement - A JSON string representing the splitting
--   requirement of a <tt>Datasource</tt>.
--   
--   Sample - '
--   "{"randomSeed":"some-random-seed","splitting":{"percentBegin":10,"percentEnd":60}}"'
cdsfsDataSpec :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromS3 S3DataSpec
data CreateDataSourceFromS3Response

-- | <a>CreateDataSourceFromS3Response</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cdsfsrDataSourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createDataSourceFromS3Response :: CreateDataSourceFromS3Response

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the datasource. This value
--   should be identical to the value of the <tt>DataSourceID</tt> in the
--   request.
cdsfsrDataSourceId :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromS3Response (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateDataSourceFromS3
instance Read CreateDataSourceFromS3
instance Show CreateDataSourceFromS3
instance Eq CreateDataSourceFromS3Response
instance Ord CreateDataSourceFromS3Response
instance Read CreateDataSourceFromS3Response
instance Show CreateDataSourceFromS3Response
instance Monoid CreateDataSourceFromS3Response
instance FromJSON CreateDataSourceFromS3Response
instance AWSRequest CreateDataSourceFromS3
instance ToJSON CreateDataSourceFromS3
instance ToHeaders CreateDataSourceFromS3
instance ToQuery CreateDataSourceFromS3
instance ToPath CreateDataSourceFromS3


-- | Creates a <a>DataSource</a> from <a>Amazon Redshift</a>. A
--   <a>DataSource</a> references data that can be used to perform either
--   <tt>CreateMLModel</tt>, <tt>CreateEvaluation</tt> or
--   <tt>CreateBatchPrediction</tt> operations.
--   
--   <a>CreateDataSourceFromRedshift</a> is an asynchronous operation. In
--   response to <a>CreateDataSourceFromRedshift</a>, Amazon Machine
--   Learning (Amazon ML) immediately returns and sets the
--   <a>DataSource</a> status to <tt>PENDING</tt>. After the
--   <a>DataSource</a> is created and ready for use, Amazon ML sets the
--   <a>Status</a> parameter to <tt>COMPLETED</tt>. <a>DataSource</a> in
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt> or <tt>PENDING</tt> status can only be used to
--   perform <tt>CreateMLModel</tt>, <tt>CreateEvaluation</tt>, or
--   <tt>CreateBatchPrediction</tt> operations.
--   
--   If Amazon ML cannot accept the input source, it sets the <a>Status</a>
--   parameter to <tt>FAILED</tt> and includes an error message in the
--   <tt>Message</tt> attribute of the <tt>GetDataSource</tt> operation
--   response.
--   
--   The observations should exist in the database hosted on an Amazon
--   Redshift cluster and should be specified by a <tt>SelectSqlQuery</tt>.
--   Amazon ML executes <a>Unload</a> command in Amazon Redshift to
--   transfer the result set of <tt>SelectSqlQuery</tt> to
--   'S3StagingLocation.'
--   
--   After the <a>DataSource</a> is created, it's ready for use in
--   evaluations and batch predictions. If you plan to use the
--   <a>DataSource</a> to train an <a>MLModel</a>, the <a>DataSource</a>
--   requires another item -- a recipe. A recipe describes the observation
--   variables that participate in training an <a>MLModel</a>. A recipe
--   describes how each input variable will be used in training. Will the
--   variable be included or excluded from training? Will the variable be
--   manipulated, for example, combined with another variable or split
--   apart into word combinations? The recipe provides answers to these
--   questions. For more information, see the Amazon Machine Learning
--   Developer Guide.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://http://docs.aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/latest/APIReference/API_CreateDataSourceFromRedshift.html</a>
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning.CreateDataSourceFromRedshift
data CreateDataSourceFromRedshift

-- | <a>CreateDataSourceFromRedshift</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cdsfrComputeStatistics</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfrDataSourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfrDataSourceName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfrDataSpec</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>RedshiftDataSpec</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfrRoleARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createDataSourceFromRedshift :: Text -> RedshiftDataSpec -> Text -> CreateDataSourceFromRedshift

-- | The compute statistics for a <a>DataSource</a>. The statistics are
--   generated from the observation data referenced by a <a>DataSource</a>.
--   Amazon ML uses the statistics internally during <a>MLModel</a>
--   training. This parameter must be set to <tt>true</tt> if the
--   ''DataSource'' needs to be used for <a>MLModel</a> training
cdsfrComputeStatistics :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRedshift (Maybe Bool)

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the <a>DataSource</a>.
cdsfrDataSourceId :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRedshift Text

-- | A user-supplied name or description of the <a>DataSource</a>.
cdsfrDataSourceName :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRedshift (Maybe Text)

-- | The data specification of an Amazon Redshift <a>DataSource</a>:
--   
--   DatabaseInformation - 'DatabaseName ' - Name of the Amazon Redshift
--   database. ' ClusterIdentifier ' - Unique ID for the Amazon Redshift
--   cluster.
--   
--   DatabaseCredentials - AWS Identity abd Access Management (IAM)
--   credentials that are used to connect to the Amazon Redshift database.
--   
--   SelectSqlQuery - Query that is used to retrieve the observation data
--   for the <tt>Datasource</tt>.
--   
--   S3StagingLocation - Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) location
--   for staging Amazon Redshift data. The data retrieved from Amazon
--   Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) using <tt>SelectSqlQuery</tt>
--   is stored in this location.
--   
--   DataSchemaUri - Amazon S3 location of the <tt>DataSchema</tt>.
--   
--   DataSchema - A JSON string representing the schema. This is not
--   required if <tt>DataSchemaUri</tt> is specified.
--   
--   DataRearrangement - A JSON string representing the splitting
--   requirement of a <tt>Datasource</tt>.
--   
--   Sample - '
--   "{"randomSeed":"some-random-seed","splitting":{"percentBegin":10,"percentEnd":60}}"'
cdsfrDataSpec :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRedshift RedshiftDataSpec

-- | A fully specified role Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Amazon ML assumes
--   the role on behalf of the user to create the following:
--   
--   A security group to allow Amazon ML to execute the
--   <tt>SelectSqlQuery</tt> query on an Amazon Redshift cluster
--   
--   An Amazon S3 bucket policy to grant Amazon ML read/write permissions
--   on the <tt>S3StagingLocation</tt>
cdsfrRoleARN :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRedshift Text
data CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse

-- | <a>CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cdsfrrDataSourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse :: CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the datasource. This value
--   should be identical to the value of the <tt>DataSourceID</tt> in the
--   request.
cdsfrrDataSourceId :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateDataSourceFromRedshift
instance Read CreateDataSourceFromRedshift
instance Show CreateDataSourceFromRedshift
instance Eq CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse
instance Ord CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse
instance Read CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse
instance Show CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse
instance Monoid CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse
instance FromJSON CreateDataSourceFromRedshiftResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateDataSourceFromRedshift
instance ToJSON CreateDataSourceFromRedshift
instance ToHeaders CreateDataSourceFromRedshift
instance ToQuery CreateDataSourceFromRedshift
instance ToPath CreateDataSourceFromRedshift


-- | Creates a <a>DataSource</a> object from an <a>Amazon Relational
--   Database Service</a> (Amazon RDS). A <a>DataSource</a> references data
--   that can be used to perform <tt>CreateMLModel</tt>,
--   <tt>CreateEvaluation</tt>, or <tt>CreateBatchPrediction</tt>
--   operations.
--   
--   <a>CreateDataSourceFromRDS</a> is an asynchronous operation. In
--   response to <a>CreateDataSourceFromRDS</a>, Amazon Machine Learning
--   (Amazon ML) immediately returns and sets the <a>DataSource</a> status
--   to <tt>PENDING</tt>. After the <a>DataSource</a> is created and ready
--   for use, Amazon ML sets the <a>Status</a> parameter to
--   <tt>COMPLETED</tt>. <a>DataSource</a> in <tt>COMPLETED</tt> or
--   <tt>PENDING</tt> status can only be used to perform
--   <tt>CreateMLModel</tt>, <tt>CreateEvaluation</tt>, or
--   <tt>CreateBatchPrediction</tt> operations.
--   
--   If Amazon ML cannot accept the input source, it sets the <a>Status</a>
--   parameter to <tt>FAILED</tt> and includes an error message in the
--   <tt>Message</tt> attribute of the <tt>GetDataSource</tt> operation
--   response.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://http://docs.aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/latest/APIReference/API_CreateDataSourceFromRDS.html</a>
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning.CreateDataSourceFromRDS
data CreateDataSourceFromRDS

-- | <a>CreateDataSourceFromRDS</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cdsfrdsComputeStatistics</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Bool</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfrdsDataSourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfrdsDataSourceName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfrdsRDSData</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>RDSDataSpec</a></li>
--   <li><a>cdsfrdsRoleARN</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createDataSourceFromRDS :: Text -> RDSDataSpec -> Text -> CreateDataSourceFromRDS

-- | The compute statistics for a <a>DataSource</a>. The statistics are
--   generated from the observation data referenced by a <a>DataSource</a>.
--   Amazon ML uses the statistics internally during an <a>MLModel</a>
--   training. This parameter must be set to <tt>true</tt> if the
--   ''DataSource'' needs to be used for <a>MLModel</a> training.
cdsfrdsComputeStatistics :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRDS (Maybe Bool)

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the <a>DataSource</a>.
--   Typically, an Amazon Resource Number (ARN) becomes the ID for a
--   <a>DataSource</a>.
cdsfrdsDataSourceId :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRDS Text

-- | A user-supplied name or description of the <a>DataSource</a>.
cdsfrdsDataSourceName :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRDS (Maybe Text)

-- | The data specification of an Amazon RDS <a>DataSource</a>:
--   
--   DatabaseInformation - 'DatabaseName ' - Name of the Amazon RDS
--   database. 'InstanceIdentifier ' - Unique identifier for the Amazon RDS
--   database instance.
--   
--   DatabaseCredentials - AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
--   credentials that are used to connect to the Amazon RDS database.
--   
--   ResourceRole - Role (DataPipelineDefaultResourceRole) assumed by an
--   Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instance to carry out the copy task
--   from Amazon RDS to Amazon S3. For more information, see <a>Role
--   templates</a> for data pipelines.
--   
--   ServiceRole - Role (DataPipelineDefaultRole) assumed by the AWS Data
--   Pipeline service to monitor the progress of the copy task from Amazon
--   RDS to Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3). For more information, see
--   <a>Role templates</a> for data pipelines.
--   
--   SecurityInfo - Security information to use to access an Amazon RDS
--   instance. You need to set up appropriate ingress rules for the
--   security entity IDs provided to allow access to the Amazon RDS
--   instance. Specify a [<tt>SubnetId</tt>, <tt>SecurityGroupIds</tt>]
--   pair for a VPC-based Amazon RDS instance.
--   
--   SelectSqlQuery - Query that is used to retrieve the observation data
--   for the <tt>Datasource</tt>.
--   
--   S3StagingLocation - Amazon S3 location for staging RDS data. The data
--   retrieved from Amazon RDS using <tt>SelectSqlQuery</tt> is stored in
--   this location.
--   
--   DataSchemaUri - Amazon S3 location of the <tt>DataSchema</tt>.
--   
--   DataSchema - A JSON string representing the schema. This is not
--   required if <tt>DataSchemaUri</tt> is specified.
--   
--   DataRearrangement - A JSON string representing the splitting
--   requirement of a <tt>Datasource</tt>.
--   
--   Sample - '
--   "{"randomSeed":"some-random-seed","splitting":{"percentBegin":10,"percentEnd":60}}"'
cdsfrdsRDSData :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRDS RDSDataSpec

-- | The role that Amazon ML assumes on behalf of the user to create and
--   activate a data pipeline in the user’s account and copy data (using
--   the <tt>SelectSqlQuery</tt>) query from Amazon RDS to Amazon S3.
cdsfrdsRoleARN :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRDS Text
data CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse

-- | <a>CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cdsfrdsrDataSourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createDataSourceFromRDSResponse :: CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the datasource. This value
--   should be identical to the value of the <tt>DataSourceID</tt> in the
--   request.
cdsfrdsrDataSourceId :: Lens' CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateDataSourceFromRDS
instance Read CreateDataSourceFromRDS
instance Show CreateDataSourceFromRDS
instance Eq CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse
instance Ord CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse
instance Read CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse
instance Show CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse
instance Monoid CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse
instance FromJSON CreateDataSourceFromRDSResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateDataSourceFromRDS
instance ToJSON CreateDataSourceFromRDS
instance ToHeaders CreateDataSourceFromRDS
instance ToQuery CreateDataSourceFromRDS
instance ToPath CreateDataSourceFromRDS


-- | Generates predictions for a group of observations. The observations to
--   process exist in one or more data files referenced by a
--   <a>DataSource</a>. This operation creates a new
--   <a>BatchPrediction</a>, and uses an <a>MLModel</a> and the data files
--   referenced by the <a>DataSource</a> as information sources.
--   
--   <a>CreateBatchPrediction</a> is an asynchronous operation. In response
--   to <a>CreateBatchPrediction</a>, Amazon Machine Learning (Amazon ML)
--   immediately returns and sets the <a>BatchPrediction</a> status to
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>. After the <a>BatchPrediction</a> completes, Amazon
--   ML sets the status to <tt>COMPLETED</tt>.
--   
--   You can poll for status updates by using the
--   <tt>GetBatchPrediction</tt> operation and checking the <a>Status</a>
--   parameter of the result. After the <tt>COMPLETED</tt> status appears,
--   the results are available in the location specified by the
--   <tt>OutputUri</tt> parameter.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://http://docs.aws.amazon.com/machine-learning/latest/APIReference/API_CreateBatchPrediction.html</a>
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning.CreateBatchPrediction
data CreateBatchPrediction

-- | <a>CreateBatchPrediction</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cbpBatchPredictionDataSourceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cbpBatchPredictionId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cbpBatchPredictionName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cbpMLModelId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>cbpOutputUri</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createBatchPrediction :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateBatchPrediction

-- | The ID of the <a>DataSource</a> that points to the group of
--   observations to predict.
cbpBatchPredictionDataSourceId :: Lens' CreateBatchPrediction Text

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the
--   <a>BatchPrediction</a>.
cbpBatchPredictionId :: Lens' CreateBatchPrediction Text

-- | A user-supplied name or description of the <a>BatchPrediction</a>.
--   <tt>BatchPredictionName</tt> can only use the UTF-8 character set.
cbpBatchPredictionName :: Lens' CreateBatchPrediction (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the <a>MLModel</a> that will generate predictions for the
--   group of observations.
cbpMLModelId :: Lens' CreateBatchPrediction Text

-- | The location of an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or
--   directory to store the batch prediction results. The following
--   substrings are not allowed in the s3 key portion of the "outputURI"
--   field: <tt>:</tt>, <tt>//</tt>, <tt>/./</tt>, <tt>/../</tt>.
--   
--   Amazon ML needs permissions to store and retrieve the logs on your
--   behalf. For information about how to set permissions, see the
--   <a>Amazon Machine LearningDeveloper Guide</a>.
cbpOutputUri :: Lens' CreateBatchPrediction Text
data CreateBatchPredictionResponse

-- | <a>CreateBatchPredictionResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cbprBatchPredictionId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createBatchPredictionResponse :: CreateBatchPredictionResponse

-- | A user-supplied ID that uniquely identifies the
--   <a>BatchPrediction</a>. This value is identical to the value of the
--   <tt>BatchPredictionId</tt> in the request.
cbprBatchPredictionId :: Lens' CreateBatchPredictionResponse (Maybe Text)
instance Eq CreateBatchPrediction
instance Ord CreateBatchPrediction
instance Read CreateBatchPrediction
instance Show CreateBatchPrediction
instance Eq CreateBatchPredictionResponse
instance Ord CreateBatchPredictionResponse
instance Read CreateBatchPredictionResponse
instance Show CreateBatchPredictionResponse
instance Monoid CreateBatchPredictionResponse
instance FromJSON CreateBatchPredictionResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateBatchPrediction
instance ToJSON CreateBatchPrediction
instance ToHeaders CreateBatchPrediction
instance ToQuery CreateBatchPrediction
instance ToPath CreateBatchPrediction


-- | Amazon Machine Learning (Amazon ML) is a robust machine learning
--   platform that allows software developers to build and train predictive
--   applications and host those applications in a scalable AWS cloud
--   solution.
module Network.AWS.MachineLearning
